summary: The bill, titled the Bringing Unfair Reporting Duties to Electeds Now Act (BURDEN Act), requires Members of Congress to certify that they meet work requirements similar to those for Medicaid and the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) in order to enroll in the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program. It mandates monthly written certifications demonstrating community engagement (as defined in the Social Security Act) and compliance with SNAP work requirements.
